thread.title: For Opening Day, Baseball Is Racing to Perfect...the Infield Dirt

author: James R. Hagerty
title: For Opening Day, Baseball Is Racing to Perfect...the Infield Dirt
text:
When the Seattle Mariners play their home opener Thursday, some of the dirt on the infield will have come from 2,500 miles away, in Pennsylvania.
Baseball teams used to get any old dirt for infields and pitchers mounds, scooping soil from a nearby hillside or riverbed. Now, egged on by specialist baseball-soil suppliers, they apply nearly as much science to the dirt as they do to the pitching rotation.
